subsc: Banking,Aviation,General industry and trade sector,General finance sector,Central government administration
trustfund:
TF021845-REFORMS IN THE BOLIVIAN PENSION SYSTEM,TF021175-NETHERLANDS' GRANT TO
            BOLIVIA SAC,TF022465-DRF-COMMERCIAL DEBT REDUCTION PROGRAM

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Structural Adjustment
            Program Project for Bolivia were as follows: the overall
            outcome of the program is satisfactory. The despite the
            successes, the fiscal balance and balance of payments remain
            fragile. The Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Social sector
            and direct poverty related issues should be dealt with
            directly-i.e., either through a carefully designed
            sub-program or through separate sectoral operations-and not
            included as marginal elements in a structural adjustment
            program. Minor actions do not contribute to resolve the
            structural problems of the social sectors and detract the
            focus on the other key sectors included in the program. To
            avoid delays in the implementation and allow for greater
            focus, technical assistance supporting a structural
            adjustment program should be handled through a separate
            operation that is prepared in advance and implemented in
            parallel. Furthermore, sufficient institutional capacity
            needs to be developed through such technical assistance to
            implement the program in a timely manner.
